entry.value: ${filename}|${now():format("dd-MM-yyyy.HH:mm:ss")}|ERROR|Error while getting the attributes from conf file|${errors}

flowFileList = session.get(100) noOfFiles=flowFileList.size() fileNumber=1 if(!flowFileList.isEmpty()) { flowFileList.each { flowFile -> flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.count', (String)noOfFiles) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.index', (String)fileNumber) session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) fileNumber++ } }

try: import json from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import OutputStreamCallback flowfile=session.get() if(flowfile): column_type=flowfile.getAttribute('column_type') column_name=flowfile.getAttribute('column_name') types_dict=flowfile.getAttribute('types_dict') avro_schema=flowfile.getAttribute('avro.schema') logical_types=flowfile.getAttribute('logical_types') column_type=json.loads(column_type) column_name=json.loads(column_name) avro_schema=json.loads(avro_schema) types_dict=json.loads(types_dict) logical_types=json.loads(logical_types) flowfile = session.putAttribute(flowfile, 'old_avro.schema', json.dumps(avro_schema))
for field in avro_schema["fields"]: for col in column_name: if (field['name'] == col): if(column_type[column_name.index(col)] in types_dict): field['type']=["null",types_dict[column_type[column_name.index(col)]]] if(column_type[column_name.index(col)] in logical_types): field['logicalType']=logical_types[column_type[column_name.index(col)]] else: field['type']="string" break else: continue
flowfile = session.putAttribute(flowfile, 'avro.schema', json.dumps(avro_schema)) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_SUCCESS) except Exception as ERROR: class PyOutputStreamCallback(OutputStreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, outputStream): outputStream.write("there has been error at: "+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")+"message- "+str(ERROR)) flowfile = session.write(flowfile, PyOutputStreamCallback()) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_FAILURE)

SELECT * FROM ALL_TAB_COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME ='${table_name}' AND OWNER='${schema}'

import requests import json import time from datetime import datetime from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import OutputStreamCallback #here is the command to take the flowfile from the queue flowfile = session.get()
#sometimes the script cant take the flowfile so im doing this if if (flowfile != None): #getting the flowfile attributes - its coming with square-brackets so i'm getting rid of them with [1:-1] they are all strings URL = "http://admin:admin@hdpsecured.amdocs.com:21000" db_schema=flowfile.getAttribute('schema') column_name=flowfile.getAttribute('column_name') column_type=flowfile.getAttribute('column_type') column_id=flowfile.getAttribute('column_id') #to be able to work with each atrribute in the column lists i'm casting those strings to lists column_name1= json.loads(column_name) column_id1= json.loads(column_id) column_type1= json.loads(column_type) json_text="Test"
data_source=flowfile.getAttribute('data_source') table_name=flowfile.getAttribute('table_name') db_type=flowfile.getAttribute('db_type').upper() hdfs_path=flowfile.getAttribute('hdfs_path') cols=[] #objects declaration to future parts of the script guids={} guid_list=[] bulk_json=[]
#the headers for the post command - it is mandatory post_headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8', 'Accept': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8' }
leng = len(column_name1)
# running on every column and creating the proper json to the atlas insertion try: for colNum in range(0,len(column_name1)): json_to_Atlas = { "typeName": "DbColumnType", "attributes": { "name": column_name1[colNum], "type": column_type1[colNum], "position": column_id1[colNum], "qualifiedName": column_name1[colNum] + "_" + db_schema } } bulk_json.append(json_to_Atlas)
json_text = "Test2"
bulk_json = {"entities": bulk_json} bulk_json = json.dumps(bulk_json, ensure_ascii=False)
# this is the post request r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity/bulk", bulk_json, headers=post_headers) if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = bulk_json raise Exception("Atlas returned code " + r.status_code + " " + r.text)
response_text = r.text json_text = "Test3"
# i'm taking the guids and assigning them as attribute to the flow file to relate the rdbms table to those columns response_text_json = json.loads(response_text) guid_list = [] for guid in response_text_json["guidAssignments"].values(): guid_list.append(guid)
# creating the hdfs_path entity in atlas hdfs_to_atlas = { "entity": { "typeName": "hdfs_path", "attributes": { "name": table_name + "." + db_schema + "." + data_source, "path": hdfs_path, "qualifiedName": table_name + "." + db_schema + "." + data_source } } } hdfs_to_atlas = json.dumps(hdfs_to_atlas, ensure_ascii=False) r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity", hdfs_to_atlas, headers=post_headers) if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = hdfs_to_atlas raise Exception("Atlas returned code " + r.status_code + " " + r.text) # taking the hdfs path guid for the rdbms table hdfs_guid = str(r.text)
# clearing the unneeded content guid_loc = hdfs_guid.find("guidAssignments") + 17 hdfs_guid = hdfs_guid[guid_loc:-1] hdfs_guid = list(json.loads(hdfs_guid, encoding='utf-8').values()) json_text = "Test4"
# the rdbms json rdbms_to_atlas = { "entity": { "typeName": "RDBMS_Table", "attributes": { "name": table_name, "data_source_type": db_type, "last_update": int(time.time() * 1000), "qualifiedName": data_source+ "." + db_schema + "." + table_name, "data_source": { "rdb_descriptor": { "db_server_name": data_source, "db_schema": db_schema }, "source_type": db_type.upper() }, "hdfs_location": { "typeName": "hdfs_path", "guid": hdfs_guid[0] } } } }
# it is commented because the columns handler is not working right now
for guid in range(0, len(guid_list)): location = {"typeName": "DbColumnType", "guid": str(guid_list[guid])} cols.append(location) rdbms_to_atlas["entity"]["attributes"]["columns"] = cols
rdbms_to_atlas = json.dumps(rdbms_to_atlas, ensure_ascii=False) r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity", rdbms_to_atlas, headers=post_headers) if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = rdbms_to_atlas raise Exception("Atlas returned code " + r.status_code + " " + r.text)
class PyOutputStreamCallback(OutputStreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, outputStream): outputStream.write("Atlas RDBMS Table created - "+data_source+ "." + db_schema + "." + table_name+" at "+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"))
flowfile = session.write(flowfile, PyOutputStreamCallback())
session.transfer(flowfile, REL_SUCCESS) except Exception as ERROR: class PyOutputStreamCallback(OutputStreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, outputStream): outputStream.write("there has been error at: "+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")+"message- "+str(ERROR)) flowfile = session.write(flowfile, PyOutputStreamCallback()) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_FAILURE)
